column5: For Christmas i got a nice little Kodak Easy Share camera, not a big expensive professional camera but one that fit's in the pocket easy while fishing lol. Here are a few pictures i took:         Not bad pic's for a 7 mega pixels. Can't wait to get some pictures of me and some big fish on this camera!
7 Mp is way plenty for almost anything.  I am still trying to get nice shots with my camera - it has lots of features, I am working at learning how they work.
Really? Great! My camera has a few settings, auto,close up,and motion...think it can take video to   I guess i will be having some short fishing clips for you all come the summer

Nice shots Mike. 7 mp is arguably too high for a point and shoot camera. Anything above 5 mp or so is when problems start occurring in photo quality. It's all because of the relatively small sensor size in point and shoots. The only reason that you might want a higher mp rating is if you plan to print large copies of your shots. I just had a 30" x 20" enlargement made of a shot that I took with a 5 mp camera. It turned out awesome.
nice pictures mike! whatever river you were at..it looks blown out...yumm, chocolate.....

I just found out my camera has a bunch of different settings, here is another quick picture using this indoor close up setting:   I guess i need to experiment with the settings and use what is right for the picture im taking....photogoraphy is new to me lol

I have the classic, sony digital camera, and i plan on buying a new zoom-in lens for it... also i am using my school's DSLR for the time being (im in a photography class if anyones wondering ) but i plan on also buying a DSLR as soon as i get that kinda money
These two could would make great paintings or puzzle pictures Doug. I am totally desperate for anything cottage like right now and these two hit the spot. Nice pictures all! Jim
